intro: Tanacetum elatum, commonly known as the tall tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring narrow, gray-green leaves and yellow-orange composite flowers. Its botanical features include a stout, branched stem and a distinctive, aromatic scent. Tanacetum elatum is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
